item.title: Cognitive Alignment in Personality Reasoning: Leveraging Prototype Theory for MBTI Inference
item.description: arXiv:2511.00115v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Personality recognition from text is typically cast as hard-label classification, which obscures the graded, prototype-like nature of human personality judgments. We present ProtoMBTI, a cognitively aligned framework for MBTI inference that operationa...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompt, framework, arxiv, alignment, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: ParaScopes: What do Language Models Activations Encode About Future Text?
item.description: arXiv:2511.00180v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Interpretability studies in language models often investigate forward-looking representations of activations. However, as language models become capable of doing ever longer time horizon tasks, methods for understanding activations often remain limite...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, arxiv, context, model, RAG | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: AgentBnB: A Browser-Based Cybersecurity Tabletop Exercise with Large Language Model Support and Retrieval-Aligned Scaffolding
item.description: arXiv:2511.00265v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Traditional cybersecurity tabletop exercises (TTXs) provide valuable training but are often scripted, resource-intensive, and difficult to scale. We introduce AgentBnB, a browser-based re-imagining of the Backdoors & Breaches game that integrates larg...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, prompt, arxiv, augmented, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Adaptive Data Flywheel: Applying MAPE Control Loops to AI Agent Improvement
item.description: arXiv:2510.27051v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Enterprise AI agents must continuously adapt to maintain accuracy, reduce latency, and remain aligned with user needs. We present a practical implementation of a data flywheel in NVInfo AI, NVIDIA's Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) Knowledge Assistant serving...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> product, arxiv, augmented, analysis, fine-tuning | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> vector, framework, knowledge base, LLM, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
